
Table of xorshift tuples with maximal period of 2^24-1 = 16777215.  Each number
represents one of 18 operations from the list below.  Each tuple represents the
function composition of the these operations, from left to right.  The carry is
cleared before the first operations (in other words, the first shift operation
is asl or lsr instead of rol or ror).

These are the 18 operations on three bytes a, b, c:

 1: b ^= a   7: b ^= rol(a)  13: b ^= ror(a)
 2: c ^= a   8: c ^= rol(a)  14: c ^= ror(a)
 3: c ^= b   9: c ^= rol(b)  15: c ^= ror(b)
 4: a ^= b  10: a ^= rol(b)  16: a ^= ror(b)
 5: a ^= c  11: a ^= rol(c)  17: a ^= ror(c)
 6: b ^= c  12: b ^= rol(c)  18: b ^= ror(c)

The table can be extended by permuting the bytes (a, b, c) and permuting the
shift operations (rol, ror).  The number in front is an indicator of how the
coefficients of the minimal polynomial over F2 (of degree 24) are distributed.
Lower score is better.

   0: 1 10 6 16 14
   0: 1 12 10 2 16
   0: 1 12 16 10 14
   0: 7 12 10 4 8
   0: 7 12 4 10 8
   0: 7 15 9 17 6
   0: 7 15 9 6 17
   0: 7 3 9 11 12
   0: 7 5 13 15 4
   0: 7 5 13 4 15
   0: 7 6 15 9 17
   0: 7 6 9 5 15
   0: 7 9 3 11 12
   0: 7 9 5 15 6        <-- This sequence is used for the rnd command.
  64: 1 10 17 14 3
  64: 1 10 17 3 14
  64: 1 11 2 10 7
  64: 1 12 5 9 16
  64: 1 5 12 9 16
  64: 1 5 8 15 18
  64: 1 7 10 6 9
  64: 1 8 11 18 3
  64: 7 1 10 6 9
  64: 7 10 15 6 2
  64: 7 10 6 9 1
  64: 7 12 10 1 15
  64: 7 14 9 11 13
  64: 7 15 17 12 13
  64: 7 18 15 2 4
  64: 7 18 2 15 4
  64: 7 18 2 4 15
  64: 7 2 10 15 6
  64: 7 3 18 16 15
  64: 7 4 12 3 9
  64: 7 4 12 9 3
  64: 7 6 2 10 15

Appendix: All tuples with a maximal period that consist of six operations with
a score of 0 (as in the table above):
